packages.descl: This framework provides additional image format plugins for QtGui. As such it is not required for the compilation of any other software, but may be a runtime requirement for Qt-based software to support certain image formats.

packages.name: kimagemapeditor
packages.descl: An HTML image map editor.

packages.name: kimap
packages.descs: kimap (API for the handling of IMAP data)
packages.descl: The kimap library contains an API for the handling of IMAP data.

packages.name: kinfocenter
packages.descl: KInfocenter gives you a host of information about your hardware and its capabilities.

packages.name: kinit
packages.descl: kdeinit is a process launcher somewhat similar to the famous init used for booting. It launches processes by forking and then loading a dynamic library which should contain a 'kdemain(...)' function. Using kdeinit to launch KDE applications makes starting a typical KDE application 2.5 times faster and reduces memory consumption.

packages.name: kio
packages.descl: This framework implements almost all the file management functions you will ever need. In fact, the KDE file manager (Dolphin) and the KDE file dialog also use this to provide network-enabled file management. It supports accessing files locally as well as via HTTP and FTP out of the box and can be extended by plugins to support other protocols as well. There are a variety of plugins available, e.g. to support access via SSH.

packages.name: kio-extras
packages.descl: Additional components to increase the functionality of KIO.

packages.name: kio-gdrive
packages.descl: KIO GDrive is a KIO helper that enables KIO-aware applications (such as Dolphin, Kate or Gwenview) to access and edit Google Drive files in the cloud.  Homepage: https://community.kde.org/KIO_GDrive

packages.name: kipi-plugins
packages.descl: A collection of plugins extending the KDE graphics and image applications.  Homepage: https://userbase.kde.org/KIPI

packages.name: kirigami-gallery
packages.descl: Kirigami-gallery is an example gallery application built using Kirigami.  Homepage: https://www.kde.org/products/kirigami/

packages.name: kirigami2
packages.descl: Kirigami is a set of user interface components created to enable the creation of pleasant, efficient applications by KDE's Plasma team and the KDE Visual Design Group.

packages.name: kiriki
packages.descl: Kiriki is an addictive and fun dice game for KDE, designed to be played by as many as six players. Participants have to collect points by rolling five dice for up to three times per single turn.

packages.name: kitemmodels
packages.descl: KItemModels is a set of item models extending the Qt model-view framework.

packages.name: kitemviews
packages.descl: KItemViews includes a set of views, which can be used with item models. It includes views for categorizing lists and to add search filters to flat and hierarchical lists.

packages.name: kiten
packages.descl: Kiten is a Japanese reference tool. Kiten works mainly as a Japanese -> English dictionary, but it works from English -> Japanese too. This means you can write in English, Hiragana, Katakana, or Kanji to search in the dictionaries.  Homepage: https://www.kde.org/applications/education/kiten

packages.name: kitinerary
packages.descl: Data model and extraction system for travel reservation information.  Homepage: https://api.kde.org/kdepim/kitinerary/html/index.html

packages.name: kjobwidgets
packages.descl: KJobWIdgets provides widgets for showing progress of asynchronous jobs.

packages.name: kjots
packages.descl: KJots is a note-taking application that organises all of your notes into separate books.  Homepage:  https://www.kde.org/applications/utilities/kjots/

packages.name: kjs
packages.descl: The KJS library provides an ECMAScript compatible interpreter. The ECMA standard is based on well known scripting languages such as Mozilla's JavaScript and Microsoft's JScript.

packages.name: kjsembed
packages.descl: KSJEmbed provides a method of binding JavaScript objects to QObjects so you can script your applications.

packages.name: kjumpingcube
packages.descl: KJumpingcube is a simple dice driven tactical game. The playing area consists of squares containing points. Players move by clicking on either a vacant square, or on one of their own squares.

packages.name: kldap
packages.descl: kldap allows LDAP accessing with a convenient Qt style C++ API.

packages.name: kleopatra
packages.descl: Certificate Manager and Unified Crypto GUI.

packages.name: klickety
packages.descl: Klickety is a strategy game for KDE, an adaption of the Clickomania game. The rules are similar to those of the Same game: your goal is to clear the board by clicking on groups to destroy them.

packages.name: klines
packages.descl: KLines is a simple but highly addictive, one player game for KDE. KLines has been inspired by well known game of Color Lines, written by Olga Demina, Igor Ivkin and Gennady Denisov back in 1992. You can also play an online demo version of this game.

packages.name: kmag
packages.descl: KMag is a small utility for Linux to magnify a part of the screen. KMag is very useful for people with visual disabilities and for those working in the fields of image analysis, web development etc.  Homepage: https://kde.org/applications/utilities/org.kde.kmag

packages.name: kmahjongg
packages.descl: KMahjongg is a clone of the well known tile based patience game of the same name. In the game you have to empty a game board filled with pieces, by pairwise removal of pieces of the same type.

packages.name: kmail
packages.descl: KMail is a state-of-the-art email client that integrates well with widely used email providers like GMail. It provides many tools and features to maximize your productivity and makes working with large email accounts easy and fast. KMail supports a large variety of email protocols - POP3, IMAP, Microsoft Exchange (EWS) and more.  Homepage: https://kde.org/applications/en/internet/org.kde.kmail2

packages.name: kmail-account-wizard
packages.descl: This is a setup wizard for KMail that will take you through the process of creating your email accounts.

packages.name: kmailtransport
packages.descl: Mail Transport Service for KMail.

packages.name: kmbox
packages.descs: kmbox (access mail storage in mbox format)
packages.descl: kmbox contains a library for accessing mail storage in MBox format.

packages.name: kmediaplayer
packages.descl: KMediaPlayer builds on the KParts framework to provide a common interface for KParts that can play media files.

packages.name: kmenuedit
packages.descl: This package provides a menu editor which may be used to edit the KDE Plasma workspaces menu or any other XDG menu.

packages.name: kmime
packages.descs: kmime (API for the handling of MIME data)
packages.descl: The kmime library contains an API for the handling of MIME data.

packages.name: kmines
packages.descl: KMines is the classic Minesweeper game. The idea is to uncover all the squares without blowing up any mines. When a mine is blown up, the game is over.

packages.name: kmix
packages.descl: KMix is an application to allow you to change the volume of your sound card. Though small, it is full-featured, and it supports several platforms and sound drivers.

packages.name: kmod
packages.descl: kmod is a set of tools to handle common tasks with Linux kernel modules like insert, remove, list, check properties, resolve dependencies and aliases. The aim is to be compatible with the tools, configurations and indexes from the module-init-tools project.  These tools are designed on top of libkmod, a library that is shipped with kmod.  Homepage: http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/kernel/kmod/

packages.name: kmousetool
packages.descl: Clicks the mouse for you, reducing hand strain.

packages.name: kmouth
packages.descl: The computer speaks the entered text for talking with people.

packages.name: kmplot
packages.descl: KmPlot is a mathematical function plotter for the KDE-Desktop. It has a built-in powerful parser. You can plot different functions simultaneously and combine them into new functions. KmPlot supports functions with parameters and functions in polar coordinates. Several grid modes are possible. Plots may be printed with high precision in correct scale.

packages.name: kmymoney
packages.descl: KMymoney is a personal finance manager for KDE which operates similarly to Microsoft Money or Quicken.  Homepage: https://kmymoney.org/

packages.name: knavalbattle
packages.descl: KNavalBattle is a battleship game with built-in game server. Ships are placed on a board which represents the sea. Players try to hit each others ships in turns without knowing where they are placed. The first player to destroy all ships wins the game.

packages.name: knetwalk
packages.descl: KNetwalk is a single player logic game. Construct the network, connecting all the terminals to the server in the fewest turns possible.

packages.name: knewstuff
packages.descl: The KNewStuff library implements collaborative data sharing for applications. It uses libattica to support the Open Collaboration Services specification.

packages.name: knights
packages.descs: knights (Chess board with XBoard protocol support)
packages.descl: KNights is a chess game. As a player, your goal is to defeat your opponent by checkmating their king.  Homepage: https://www.kde.org/applications/games/knights/

packages.name: knotes
packages.descl: KDE sticky notes application.

packages.name: knotifications
packages.descl: KNotifications is used to notify the user of an event. It covers feedback and persistent events.

packages.name: knotifyconfig
packages.descl: KNotifyConfig provides a configuration dialog for desktop notifications which can be embedded in your application.

packages.name: kolf
packages.descl: Kolf is a miniature golf game. The game is played from an overhead view, with a short bar representing the golf club. Kolf features many different types of objects, such water hazards, slopes, sand traps, and black holes (warps), among others.

packages.name: kollision
packages.descl: Kollision is a simple ball dodging game.

packages.name: kolourpaint
packages.descl: KolourPaint is a easy-to-use paint program for KDE. It aims to be conceptually simply to understand; providing a level of functionality targeted towards the average user. It's designed for tasks like: * Painting - drawing diagrams and 'finger painting' * Image Manipulation - editing photos and applying effects * Icon Editing - drawing clipart and logos with transparency

packages.name: kompare
packages.descl: kompare is a graphical file differences tool.

packages.name: konqueror
packages.descl: Konqueror is a web browser and file manager that provides web access and file-viewer functionality for file systems (such as local files, files on a remote server, and files in a disk image).  Homepage: https://kde.org/applications/internet/org.kde.konqueror

packages.name: konquest
packages.descl: This the KDE version of Gnu-Lactic Konquest, a multi-player strategy game. The goal of the game is to expand your interstellar empire across the galaxy.

packages.name: konsole
packages.descl: Konsole is a powerful and customizable terminal emulator.  Homepage: https://konsole.kde.org

packages.name: kontact
packages.descl: KDE Personal Information Manager.

packages.name: kontactinterface
packages.descl: kontactinterface is a library for embedding KParts in a Kontact component.

packages.name: kontrast
packages.descl: Kontrast is a color contrast checker and tell you if your color combinations are accessible for people with color vision defiencies.  Homepage: https://kde.org/applications/en/kontrast

packages.name: konversation
packages.descl: Konversation is a user-friendly Internet Relay Chat (IRC) client built on the KDE Platform.  Homepage: https://konversation.kde.org

packages.name: kopeninghours
packages.descl: A library for parsing and evaluating OSM opening hours expressions. OSM opening hours expressions are used to describe when a feature is open/available or closed. This format is not only used in OpenStreetMap itself, but in various other data sources or APIs needing such a description as well.  Homepage: https://github.com/KDE/kopeninghours

packages.name: kopete
packages.descl: The goals of Kopete are to provide users with a standard and easy to use interface between all of their instant messaging systems, but at the same time also providing developers with the ease of writing plugins to support a new protocol.  Homepage: http://userbase.kde.org/Kopete

packages.name: korganizer
packages.descl: Calendar and scheduling program.

packages.name: kosmindoormap
packages.descs: kosmindoormap (library for rendering OSM indoor maps)
packages.descl: A library and QML component for rendering multi-level OSM indoor maps of for example a (large) train station.  Homepage: https://commits.kde.org/kosmindoormap

packages.name: kpackage
packages.descl: KPackage is a KDE 5 Framework that lets applications manage user installable packages of non-binary assets.

packages.name: kparts
packages.descl: The KParts library implements the framework for KDE parts, which are elaborate widgets with a user-interface defined in terms of actions (menu items, toolbar icons).

packages.name: kpat
packages.descl: KPat (aka KPatience) is a relaxing card sorting game. To win the game a player has to arrange a single deck of cards in certain order amongst each other.

packages.name: kpeople
packages.descs: kpeople (library providing access to your contacts)
packages.descl: KPeople Provides access to all contacts and aggregates them by person. KPeople offers unified access to our contacts from different sources, grouping them by person while still exposing all the data. The sources are plugin-based, allowing to easily extend the contacts collection.

packages.name: kpeoplevcard
packages.descs: kpeoplevcard (library to expose vcards to kpeople)
packages.descl: kpeoplevcard is a library to expose vcards to kpeople.

packages.name: kpimtextedit
packages.descl: KPIMTextedit is a library that provides an enchanced text edit class, see TextEdit. This text is highlighted with a EMailQuoteHighlighter. It also provides so-called rich text builders, that can convert the formatted text in the text edit to all kinds of markup, like HTML or BBCODE.

packages.name: kpkpass
packages.descl: KpKPass is a library to deal with Apple Wallet pass files.

packages.name: kplotting
packages.descl: KPlotWidget is a QWidget-derived class that provides a virtual base class for easy data-plotting. The idea behind KPlotWidget is that you only have to specify information in data units; i.e., the natural units of the data being plotted. KPlotWidget automatically converts everything to screen pixel units. KPlotWidget draws X and Y axes with tick marks and tick labels, and automatically determines how many tick marks to use and where they should be, based on the data limits specified for the plot.

packages.name: kpmcore
packages.descl: kpmcore is a library for managing partitions. It contains common code for KDE Partition Manager and other projects.  See also: https://www.kde.org/applications/system/kdepartitionmanager

packages.name: kpty
packages.descl: The KPty library provides primitives to interface with pseudo terminal devices as well as a KProcess derived class for running child processes and communicating with them using a pty.

packages.name: kpublictransport
packages.descs: kpublictransport (library for accessing public transport data)
packages.descl: A library for accessing realtime public transport data and for performing public transport journey queries.

packages.name: kqtquickcharts
packages.descl: kqtquickcharts is a QtQuick plugin to render beautiful and interactive charts.

packages.name: kquickcharts
packages.descl: The Quick Charts module provides a set of charts that can be used from QtQuick applications. They are intended to be used for both simple display of data as well as continuous display of high-volume data (often referred to as plotters). The charts use a system called distance fields for their accelerated rendering, which provides ways of using the GPU for rendering 2D shapes without loss of quality.  See: https://api.kde.org/frameworks/kquickcharts/html/index.html

packages.name: krb5
packages.descl: Kerberos is a network authentication protocol. It is designed to provide strong authentication for client/server applications by using secret-key cryptography.  Homepage: http://web.mit.edu/kerberos/

packages.name: krdc
packages.descl: KRDC is a client application that allows you to view or even control the desktop session on another machine that is running a compatible server. VNC and RDP is supported.  Homepage: https://www.kde.org/applications/internet/krdc/

packages.name: krename
packages.descl: KRename is a powerful batch renamer for KDE. It allows you to easily rename hundreds or even more files in one go. The filenames can be created by parts of the original filename, numbering the files or accessing information about the file, like creation date or Exif information from an image.  Homepage: http://www.krename.net/

packages.name: kreversi
packages.descl: KReversi is a simple one player strategy game played against the computer. If a player's piece is captured by an opposing player, that piece is turned over to reveal the color of that player. A winner is declared when one player has more pieces of his own color on the board and there are no more possible moves.

packages.name: krfb
packages.descl: Krfb Desktop Sharing is a server application that allows you to share your current session with a user on another machine, who can use a VNC client to view or even control the desktop.  Homepage: https://www.kde.org/applications/system/krfb/

packages.name: krita
packages.descl: Krita is a professional free and open source painting program. It is made by artists that want to see affordable art tools for everyone.  Homepage: http://www.krita.org/

packages.name: kross
packages.descl: Kross is a scripting bridge to embed scripting functionality into an application. It supports QtScript as a scripting interpreter backend. Kross is able to optional dynamic load modules which provide additional functionality for scripts.

packages.name: kross-interpreters
packages.descl: Set of interpreter plugins for the Kross archtecture in KDE.

packages.name: kruler
packages.descl: A screen ruler and color measurement tool for KDE.

packages.name: krunner
packages.descl: KRunner is the launcher built into the Plasma desktop. While its basic function is to launch programs from a sort of mini-command-line, its functionality can be extended by runners to assist the user to accomplish a lot of tasks.

packages.name: krusader
packages.descl: Krusader is an advanced twin panel (commander style) file manager for KDE and other desktops, similar to Midnight Commander or Total Commander.  Homepage: http://krusader.org

packages.name: kscreen
packages.descl: KScreen is the new screen management software for KDE Plasma Workspaces which tries to be as magic and automatic as possible for users with basic needs and easy to configure for those who want special setups.  Homepage: http://community.kde.org/Solid/Projects/ScreenManagement

packages.name: kscreenlocker
packages.descl: Library and components for secure lock screen architecture.  Homepage: https://projects.kde.org/kscreenlocker

packages.name: kservice
packages.descl: KService provides a plugin framework for handling desktop services. Services can be applications or libraries. They can be bound to MIME types or handled by application specific code.

packages.name: ksh93
packages.descl: The KornShell language and interactive shell were designed by David G. Korn at AT&T Bell Laboratories. Besides offering a powerful interactive shell, it also offers a robust programming language with such features as associative arrays and built in integer math operations. ksh is an excellent choice for system administration scripts and for everyday interactive use.  The site for KornShell 93u+m is https://github.com/ksh93/ksh

packages.name: kshisen
packages.descl: KShisen is a solitaire-like game played using the standard set of Mahjong tiles. Unlike Mahjong however, KShisen has only one layer of scrambled tiles.

packages.name: ksirk
packages.descl: KsirK is a computerized version of the well known strategic board game R***. The goal of the game is simply to conquer the world by attacking your neighbors with your armies.

packages.name: ksmtp
packages.descl: ksmtp is a job-based library to send email through an SMTP server.

packages.name: ksnakeduel
packages.descl: KSnakeDuel is a simple snake duel game for KDE. You can play KSnakeDuel against the computer or a friend. The aim of the game is to live longer than your opponent. To do that, avoid running into a wall, your own tail, or that of your opponent.

packages.name: kspaceduel
packages.descl: In KSpaceduel each of two possible players controls a satellite spaceship orbiting the sun. As the game progresses players have to eliminate the opponent's spacecraft.

packages.name: ksquares
packages.descs: ksquares (connect the dots to create squares)
packages.descl: KSquares is a fun and exciting game for the desktop environment. The game is modeled after the well known pen and paper based game of Dots and Boxes.

packages.name: ksshaskpass
packages.descs: ksshaskpass (GUI for entering ssh key passwords)
packages.descl: If you access computers with ssh keys but those keys have passwords this module will give you a graphical UI to enter those passwords.

packages.name: kstars
packages.descl: KStars is free, open source, cross-platform Astronomy Software. It provides an accurate graphical simulation of the night sky, from any location on Earth, at any date and time. The display includes up to 100 million stars, 13,000 deep-sky objects, all 8 planets, the Sun and Moon, and thousands of comets, asteroids, supernovae, and satellites.  Homepage: https://edu.kde.org/kstars

packages.name: ksudoku
packages.descl: KSudoku is a logic-based symbol placement puzzle. The player has to fill a grid so that each column, row as well as each square block on the game field contains only one instance of each symbol.

packages.name: ksystemlog
packages.descl: KSystemLog is a system log viewer tool. This program is developed for beginner users, who don't know how to find information about their Linux system, and don't know where log files are. It is also of course designed for advanced users, who quickly want to understand problems of their machine with a more powerful and graphical tool than 'tail -f' and 'less' commands ;-)  Homepage: https://www.kde.org/applications/system/ksystemlog/

packages.name: ksystemstats
packages.descl: SystemStats is a daemon that collects statistics about the running system.

packages.name: kteatime
packages.descl: KTeaTime is a handy timer for steeping tea. No longer will you have to guess at how long it takes for your tea to be ready. Simply select the type of tea you have, and it will alert you when the tea is ready to drink.  Homepage: https://www.kde.org/applications/games/kteatime/

packages.name: ktexteditor
packages.descl: KTextEditor provides a powerful text editor component that you can embed in your application, either as a KPart or using the KF5::TextEditor library. The text editor component contains many useful features, from syntax highlighting and automatic indentation to advanced scripting support, making it suitable for everything from a simple embedded text-file editor to an advanced IDE.

packages.name: ktextwidgets
packages.descl: KTextWidgets provides widgets for displaying and editing text. It supports rich text as well as plain text.

packages.name: ktimer
packages.descl: KTimer is a little tool to execute programs after some time.  Homepage: http://utils.kde.org/projects/ktimer

packages.name: ktimetracker
packages.descl: KTimeTracker is a personal time tracker for busy people implemented as a Qt/KF5-based desktop application.

packages.name: ktnef
packages.descs: ktnef (API for the handling of TNEF data)
packages.descl: The ktnef library contains an API for the handling of TNEF data. The API permits access to the actual attachments, the message properties (TNEF/MAPI), and allows one to view/extract message formatted text in Rich Text Format format.

packages.name: ktorrent
packages.descl: KTorrent is a BitTorrent program with many features: Download torrent files (of course :-), upload and download speed capping, Internet searching, UDP trackers, port forwarding with UPnP, IP blocking, importing of partially or fully downloaded files, support for distributed hash tables, protocol encryption, bandwidth scheduling, and much more. KTorrent's developers are Joris Guisson and Ivan Vasic.  Homepage: https://kde.org/applications/en/internet/org.kde.ktorrent

packages.name: ktouch
packages.descl: KTouch is a typewriter trainer for learning to touch type. It provides you with text to train on and adjusts to different levels depending on how good you are.  Homepage: https://kde.org/applications/en/education/org.kde.ktouch

packages.name: kturtle
packages.descl: KTurtle is an educational programming environment for learning how to program. It provides all programming tools from its user interface. The programming language used is TurtleScript, which is loosely based on Logo. All commands and messages are translated into the user's language. KTurtle features an intuitive syntax highlighting, simple error messages, integrated canvas to make drawings, an integrated help, slow-motion and step execution.  Homepage: https://kde.org/applications/en/education/org.kde.kturtle

packages.name: kubrick
packages.descs: kubrick (3-D game based on Rubik's Cube)
packages.descl: Kubrick is a game based on the Rubik's Cube puzzle. The cube sizes range from 2x2x2 up to 6x6x6, or you can play with irregular 'bricks' such as 5x3x2 or 'mats' such as 6x4x1 or 2x2x1. The game has a selection of puzzles at several levels of difficulty, as well as demos of pretty patterns and solution moves, or you can make up your own puzzles.

packages.name: kunitconversion
packages.descl: KUnitConversion provides functions to convert values in different physical units. It supports converting different prefixes (e.g. kilo, mega, giga) as well as converting between different unit systems (e.g. liters, gallons).

packages.name: kwallet
packages.descl: KDE Wallet Manager is a tool to manage your passwords under KDE.  Homepage: https://projects.kde.org/projects/kde/kdeutils

packages.name: kwallet-pam
packages.descl: KWallet PAM integration.

packages.name: kwalletmanager
packages.descl: KDE Wallet Manager is a tool to manage your passwords under KDE.  Homepage: https://projects.kde.org/projects/kde/kdeutils

packages.name: kwave
packages.descl: Kwave is a sound editor built on the KDE Frameworks 5. With Kwave you can record, play back, import and edit many sorts of audio files including multi channel files. Kwave includes some plugins to transform audio files in several ways and presents a graphical view with zoom and scroll capability.  Homepage: http://kwave.sourceforge.net

packages.name: kwayland
packages.descl: Kwayland is a KDE Frameworks 5 library that wraps Client and Server Wayland libraries.

packages.name: kwayland-integration
packages.descs: kwayland-integration (wayland integration plugins for KDE Frameworks)
packages.descl: Kwayland-integration provides integration plugins for various KDE Frameworks for Wayland.

packages.name: kwayland-server
packages.descl: Wayland server components built on KDE Frameworks.

packages.name: kwidgetsaddons
packages.descl: This repository contains add-on widgets and classes for applications that use the Qt Widgets module. Provided are action classes that can be added to toolbars or menus, a wide range of widgets for selecting characters, fonts, colors, actions, dates and times, or MIME types, as well as platform-aware dialogs for configuration pages, message boxes, and password requests.

packages.name: kwin
packages.descl: KWin is a window manager for the X Window System. It is an integral part, and the default window manager of the Plasma Workspaces, but it can also be used on its own or with other desktop environments.

packages.name: kwindowsystem
packages.descl: KWindowSystem provides information about the windowing system and allows interaction with the windowing system. It provides a high level API which is windowing system independent and has platform specific implementations. This API is inspired by X11 and thus not all functionality is available on all windowing systems.

packages.name: kwordquiz
packages.descl: KWordQuiz is a general purpose flash card program. It can be used for vocabulary learning and many other subjects.

packages.name: kwrited
packages.descl: Watch for messages from local users sent with write(1) or wall(1).

packages.name: kxmlgui
packages.descl: KXMLGUI provides a framework for managing menu and toolbar actions in an abstract way. The actions are configured through an XML description and hooks in the application code. The framework supports merging of multiple description for example for integrating actions from plugins.

packages.name: kxmlrpcclient
packages.descs: kxmlrpcclient (library providing API to access XML RPC)
packages.descl: Tier 3 KDE Frameworks 5 library providing API to access XML RPC.

packages.name: lame
packages.descs: lame (LAME is an MP3 audio encoder)
packages.descl: LAME is a library and application which can be used to create compressed MP3 audio files. These audio files can be played back by popular MP3 players such as mpg123 or madplay.  Homepage: http://lame.sourceforge.net

packages.name: latte-dock
packages.descl: Latte is a dock based on Plasma Frameworks providing an elegant and intuitive experience for your tasks and plasmoids. It animates its contents by using parabolic zoom effect and tries to be there only when it is needed. 'Art in Coffee'  Homepage: https://github.com/KDE/latte-dock

packages.name: layer-shell-qt
packages.descl: This component is meant for applications to be able to easily use clients based on wlr-layer-shell.

packages.name: lbzip2
packages.descl: Lbzip2 is a Pthreads-based parallel bzip2/bunzip2 filter passable to GNU tar with the --use-compress-program option. It isn't restricted to regular files on input, nor output.  Homepage: http://lbzip2.org

packages.name: lcms
packages.descl: Little cms is a small, speed optimized color management engine.  lcms was written by Marti Maria <marti@littlecms.com>.

packages.name: lcms2
packages.descl: Little cms is a small, speed optimized color management engine.  lcms was written by Marti Maria <marti@littlecms.com>.  Homepage: http://www.littlecms.com

packages.name: lensfun
packages.descl: lensfun is a library that provide a open source database of photographic lenses and their characteristics also provides a set of algorithms for correcting images based on detailed knowledge of lens properties and calibration data.  Homepage: http://lensfun.sourceforge.net

packages.name: less
packages.descl: Less is a paginator similar to more (1), but which allows backward movement in the file as well as forward movement. Also, less does not have to read the entire input file before starting, so with large input files it starts up faster than text editors like vi (1).  Less was written by Mark Nudelman.

packages.name: lftp
packages.descl: lftp is a program that allows sophisticated ftp and http connections to other hosts. lftp can handle many file access methods including ftp, ftps, http, https, hftp, fish and file. Every operation in lftp is reliable, that is any non-fatal error is ignored and the operation is retried. lftp has shell-like command syntax. lftp has a built in mirror feature which can download or upload a whole directory tree.  Homepage: http://lftp.tech

packages.name: lhasa
packages.descl: Lhasa is a library for parsing LHA (.lzh) archives and a free replacement for the Unix LHA tool.  Currently it is only possible to read from (ie. decompress) archives; generating (compressing) LHA archives may be an enhancement for future versions.  Homepage: http://fragglet.github.com/lhasa/

packages.name: libFS

packages.descl: libXScrnSaver is part of X11.  For more information about the X.Org Foundation (the providers of the X.Org implementation of the X Window System), see their website:  http://www.x.org

packages.name: libXau
packages.descl: This is a very simple mechanism for providing individual access to an X Window System display. It uses existing core protocol and library hooks for specifying authorization data in the connection setup block to restrict use of the display to only those clients that show that they know a server-specific key called a 'magic cookie.'

packages.name: libXaw
packages.descs: libXaw (client library for the X Athena Widget Set)
packages.descl: Xaw is a widget set based on the X Toolkit Intrinsics (Xt) Library.

packages.name: libXaw3d
packages.descs: libXaw3d (3D enhanced version of the MIT Athena widget set)
packages.descl: Xaw3d is an enhanced version of the MIT Athena Widget set for the X Window System. Xaw3d adds a three-dimensional look to applications with minimal or no source code changes.  You should install Xaw3d if you are using applications which incorporate the MIT Athena widget set and you'd like to incorporate a 3D look into those applications.

packages.name: libXaw3dXft
packages.descs: libXaw3dXft (3D enhanced version of the MIT Athena widget set)
packages.descl: Xaw3dXft is an enhanced version of the MIT Athena Widget set for the X Window System. Xaw3dXft adds a three-dimensional look to applications with minimal or no source code changes.  You should install Xaw3dXft if you are using applications which incorporate the MIT Athena widget set and you'd like to incorporate a 3D look into those applications.

packages.name: libXcm
packages.descs: libXcm (reference implementation of the net-color specification)
packages.descl: The libXcm library is a reference implementation of the net-color spec. It allows to attach color regions to X windows to communicate with color servers.

packages.descl: libXcomposite is part of X11.  For more information about the X.Org Foundation (the providers of the X.Org implementation of the X Window System), see their website:  http://www.x.org

packages.descl: libXdamage is part of X11.  For more information about the X.Org Foundation (the providers of the X.Org implementation of the X Window System), see their website:  http://www.x.org

packages.descl: libXdmcp is part of X11.  For more information about the X.Org Foundation (the providers of the X.Org implementation of the X Window System), see their website:  http://www.x.org

packages.descl: libXevie is part of X11.  For more information about the X.Org Foundation (the providers of the X.Org implementation of the X Window System), see their website:  http://www.x.org

packages.name: libXfont2
packages.descl: libXfont2 provides the core of the new X11 font system, handling the index files (fonts.dir, fonts.alias, fonts.scale), the various font file formats, and rasterizing them. It is used by the X servers, the X Font Server (xfs), and some font utilities (bdftopcf for instance), but should not be used by normal X11 clients. X11 clients access fonts via either the new API's in libXft, or the legacy API's in libX11.

packages.descl: libXxf86vm is part of X11.  For more information about the X.Org Foundation (the providers of the X.Org implementation of the X Window System), see their website:  http://www.x.org

packages.name: libaio
packages.descl: The Linux-native asynchronous I/O facility ('async I/O', or 'aio') has a richer API and capability set than the simple POSIX async I/O facility. This library provides the Linux-native API for async I/O. The POSIX async I/O facility requires this library in order to provide kernel-accelerated async I/O capabilities, as do applications which require the Linux-native async I/O API.

packages.name: libao
packages.descl: Libao is a cross-platform audio library, and is required by many programs and other libraries that use audio (some examples include ogg123, GAIM, and the Ogg Vorbis libraries). This package provides plugins for OSS, ESD, aRts, and ALSA. You will need to install the supporting libraries for any plugins you want to use.

packages.name: libappindicator
packages.descs: libappindicator (Plasma 5 systray support for GTK apps)
packages.descl: A library to allow applications to export a menu into the system tray. Based on KSNI, it also works in KDE and will fallback to generic systray support (xembed) if none of those are available.  Homepage: https://launchpad.net/libappindicator

packages.name: libarchive
packages.descl: Libarchive is a programming library that can create and read several different streaming archive formats, including most popular TAR variants and several CPIO formats. It can also write SHAR archives.  Homepage: http://libarchive.org

packages.name: libassuan
packages.descl: This is the IPC library used by GnuPG 2.x, GPGME and a few other packages.

packages.name: libasyncns
packages.descl: libasyncns is a C library for asynchronous name queries. It is an asynchronous wrapper around the libc's synchronous getaddrinfo() API.  Website: http://0pointer.de/lennart/projects/libasyncns

packages.name: libatasmart
packages.descl: libatasmart is a lean, small and clean implementation of an ATA S.M.A.R.T. ((Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology) reading and parsing library. S.M.A.R.T. is a system used by hard drives to monitor factors that may impact drive reliability in the hope of predicting a drive failure before it occurs.  Homepage: http://0pointer.de/blog/projects/being-smart.html

packages.name: libblockdev
packages.descl: libblockdev is a library for manipulating block devices.  Homepage: https://github.com/rhinstaller/libblockdev

packages.name: libbluray
packages.descl: libbluray is an open-source library designed for Blu-Ray Discs playback for media players, like VLC or MPlayer.  Homepage: http://www.videolan.org/developers/libbluray.html

packages.name: libburn
packages.descl: libburn is a library for writing preformatted data onto optical media such as CD, DVD and BD (Blu-Ray). Libburn also offers a facility for reading data blocks from optical drives without using the normal block device I/O.  Homepage: https://dev.lovelyhq.com/libburnia/libburn

packages.name: libbytesize
packages.descs: libbytesize (library for working with big sizes in bytes)
packages.descl: libbytesize is a library providing a C class for working with arbitrary sizes in bytes.  Homepage: https://github.com/rhinstaller/libbytesize

packages.name: libcaca
packages.descl: The libcaca library is a graphics library that outputs text instead of pixels, so that it can work on older video cards or text terminals. It is not unlike the famous AAlib library.  Sam Hocevar is the main author of libcaca.

packages.name: libcanberra
packages.descs: libcanberra (XDG Sound Theme and Name Spec implementation)
packages.descl: libcanberra is an implementation of the XDG Sound Theme and Name Specifications, for generating event sounds on free desktops. It comes with several backends for several audio systems and is designed to be portable.  Homepage: http://0pointer.de/lennart/projects/libcanberra/

packages.name: libcap
packages.descl: This is a library for getting and setting POSIX.1e (formerly POSIX 6) draft 15 capabilities.  Libcap was written by Andrew G. Morgan; however, it would not have been possible without the help of Aleph1, Roland Buresund, Andrew Main, and Alexander Kjeldaas.  Homepage: http://sites.google.com/site/fullycapable/

packages.name: libcap-ng
packages.descl: The libcap-ng library is intended to make programming with POSIX capabilities easier. The package also includes utilities to help analyze a system for programs that may have too much privilege.  libcap-ng was written and is maintained by Steve Grubb.  Homepage: https://people.redhat.com/sgrubb/libcap-ng/

packages.name: libcddb
packages.descl: Libcddb is a library that implements the different protocols (CDDBP, HTTP, SMTP) to access data on a CDDB server (http://freedb.org).  Visit the project at: http://libcddb.sourceforge.net/

packages.name: libcdio
packages.descl: The libcdio package contains a library for CD-ROM and CD image access. Applications wishing to be oblivious of the OS and device-dependent properties of a CD-ROM or of the specific details of various CD-image formats may benefit from using this library. A library for working with ISO-9660 filesystems libiso9660 is included. A generic interface for issuing MMC (multimedia commands) is also part of the libcdio library.

packages.name: libcdio-paranoia
packages.descl: This CDDA reader distribution ('libcdio-cdparanoia') reads audio from the CDROM directly as data, with no analog step between, and writes the data to a file or pipe as .wav, .aifc or as raw 16 bit linear PCM.

packages.name: libcgroup
packages.descs: libcgroup (library and utilities for kernel control groups)
packages.descl: Control Groups provide a mechanism for aggregating/partitioning sets of tasks, and all their future children, into hierarchical groups with specialized behaviour. It makes use of a filesystem interface. This package contains a library for developing applications that use control groups, as well as some basic userspace tools for controlling and monitoring control groups.  Homepage: http://libcg.sourceforge.net/

packages.name: libclc
packages.descl: libclc is an open source, BSD/MIT dual licensed implementation of the library requirements of the OpenCL C programming language, as specified by the OpenCL 1.1 Specification.  Homepage: http://libclc.llvm.org/

packages.name: libcue
packages.descl: A CUE sheet is a metadata file which describes the layout of a CD or DVD. The libcue library is intended for parsing a CUE sheet and providing an API for programs to access the parsed data. While there is no single CUE sheet standard, libcue attempts to parse the most commonly known CUE layouts.  Homepage: https://github.com/lipnitsk/libcue

packages.name: libdbusmenu
packages.descl: A small library that was created by pulling out some common code out of indicator-applet. It passes a menu structure across DBus so that a program can create a menu without worrying about how it is displayed on the other side of the bus.  Homepage: https://launchpad.net/libdbusmenu

packages.name: libdbusmenu-qt
packages.descs: libdbusmenu-qt (Qt implementation of the DBusMenu spec)
packages.descl: This library provides a Qt implementation of the DBusMenu protocol. The DBusMenu protocol makes it possible for applications to export and import their menus over DBus.  Homepage: https://launchpad.net/libdbusmenu-qt

packages.name: libdiscid
packages.descs: libdiscid (library to generate DiscIDs from audio CDs)
packages.descl: libdiscid creates MusicBrainz DiscIDs from audio CDs. It reads the table of contents (TOC) of a CD and generates an identifier which can be used to lookup the CD at MusicBrainz. Additionally, it provides a submission URL for adding the DiscID to the database.  Home: http://musicbrainz.org/doc/libdiscid

packages.name: libdmtx
packages.descl: libdmtx is a library that enables programs to read and write Data Matrix barcodes of the modern ECC200 variety. The utility programs dmtxread and dmtxwrite also provide a command line interface for libdmtx, and serve as a good reference for developers writing their own libdmtx-enabled programs.  Homepage: https://github.com/dmtx/libdmtx

packages.name: libdmx
packages.descl: libdmx is part of X11.  For more information about the X.Org Foundation (the providers of the X.Org implementation of the X Window System), see their website:  http://www.x.org

packages.name: libdrm
packages.descs: libdrm (A library to support Direct Rendering)
packages.descl: This library implements an interface to the kernel's DRM services. It is used to support hardware accelerated 3D rendering.

packages.name: libdvdnav
packages.descl: This is mplayer's fork of libdvdnav. libdvdnav is a library that allows easy use of sophisticated DVD navigation features such as DVD menus, multiangle playback, and even interactive DVD games.  Homepage: https://www.videolan.org/developers/libdvdnav.html

packages.name: libdvdread
packages.descl: libdvdread provides a simple foundation for reading DVD video disks. It provides the functionality that is required to access many DVDs. It parses IFO files, reads NAV-blocks, and performs CSS authentication and descrambling.

packages.name: libedit
packages.descl: This is an autotool and libtoolized port of the NetBSD Editline library (libedit). This Berkeley-style licensed command line editor library provides generic line editing, history, and tokenization functions, similar to those found in GNU Readline.  Homepage: http://www.thrysoee.dk/editline/

packages.name: libepoxy
packages.descl: Epoxy is a library for handling OpenGL function pointer management.  Homepage: https://github.com/anholt/libepoxy

packages.name: liberation-fonts-ttf
packages.descl: Liberation is the collective name of three TrueType font families: Liberation Sans, Liberation Serif and Liberation Mono. These fonts are metric-compatible with Arial, Times New Roman, and Courier New respectively.  The fonts were developed by Steve Matteson of Ascender Corp. and Pravin Satpute for Red Hat, Inc.

packages.name: libevdev
packages.descl: libevdev is a wrapper library for evdev devices. It moves the common tasks when dealing with evdev devices into a library and provides a library interface to the callers, thus avoiding erroneous ioctls, etc.  Homepage: http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/libevdev/

packages.name: libevent
packages.descl: libevent is meant to replace the event loop found in event driven network servers. An application just needs to call event_dispatch() and then add or remove events dynamically without having to change the event loop. The libevent API provides a mechanism to execute a callback function when a specific event occurs on a file descriptor or after a timeout has been reached.  Homepage: http://libevent.org

packages.name: libexif
packages.descl: EXIF stands for Exchangeable Image File Format, which is a format used to store extra information in images such as the JPEG files produced by digital cameras. The libexif library allows programs such as gthumb to parse, edit, and save EXIF data.  Homepage: https://libexif.github.io

packages.name: libfakekey
packages.descl: X virtual keyboard library of the Matchbox WM project.  Homepage: http://git.yoctoproject.org/cgit.cgi/libfakekey/

packages.name: libffi
packages.descs: libffi (A Portable Foreign Function Interface Library)
packages.descl: FFI stands for Foreign Function Interface. A foreign function interface is the popular name for the interface that allows code written in one language to call code written in another language. The libffi library really only provides the lowest, machine dependent layer of a fully featured foreign function interface.  Homepage: https://sourceware.org/libffi/

packages.name: libfontenc
packages.descl: libfontenc is part of X11.  For more information about the X.Org Foundation (the providers of the X.Org implementation of the X Window System), see their website:  http://www.x.org

packages.name: libgcrypt
packages.descl: Libgcrypt is a general purpose crypto library based on the code used in GnuPG.

packages.name: libgee
packages.descl: libgee is a collection library providing GObject-based interfaces and classes for commonly used data structures.  Homepage: http://live.gnome.org/Libgee

packages.name: libglade
packages.descl: The GLADE library allows loading user interfaces which are stored externally into a program. This allows the interface to be changed without recompiling the program. The interfaces can also be edited with GLADE.

packages.name: libglvnd
packages.descl: libglvnd is a vendor-neutral dispatch layer for arbitrating OpenGL API calls between multiple vendors. It allows multiple drivers from different vendors to coexist on the same filesystem, and determines which vendor to dispatch each API call to at runtime.  Homepage: https://github.com/NVIDIA/libglvnd

packages.name: libgnome-keyring
packages.descl: gnome-keyring is a program that keep password and other secrets for users. The library libgnome-keyring is used by applications to integrate with the gnome keyring system.

packages.name: libgnt
packages.descl: GNT is an ncurses toolkit for creating text-mode graphical user interfaces in a fast and easy way. It is based on GLib and ncurses. It was born out of the console-based UI, Finch, for the libpurple project, but has now been split into its own independent repository.  Homepage: https://keep.imfreedom.org/libgnt/libgnt

packages.name: libgpg-error
packages.descl: This is a library that defines common error values for all GnuPG components. Among these are GPG, GPGSM, GPGME, GPG-Agent, libgcrypt, Libksba, DirMngr, Pinentry, SmartCard Daemon, and more.

packages.name: libgphoto2
packages.descl: libgphoto2 is a library that can be used by applications to access various digital cameras.  Homepage: http://www.gphoto.org/

packages.name: libgpod
packages.descs: libgpod (A library for connecting to some sort of media device ;-)
packages.descl: libgpod for accessing iPod content. It provides an easy to use way to retrieve the list of files and playlist stored on an iPod, to modify them and to save them back to the iPod.  If you decide to make improvements please contact us so we can work together. Just drop a mail to: Gtkpod-devel@lists.sourceforge.net (you may ask to be CC in the answer).

packages.name: libgravatar
packages.descl: libgravatar is a KDE PIM library providing Gravatar support.

packages.name: libgsf
packages.descl: libgsf aims to provide an efficient extensible I/O abstraction for dealing with different structured file formats.  libgsf is used by libwv2, which is used by various word processors to import .doc format files.

packages.name: libgtop
packages.descl: A library that fetches information about the running system such as CPU and memory usage, active processes, etc. The information is taken directly from the /proc filesystem.  http://library.gnome.org/devel/libgtop/

packages.name: libgudev
packages.descl: This is libgudev, a library providing GObject bindings for libudev. It used to be part of udev, but it's now a project on its own.  Homepage: http://wiki.gnome.org/Projects/libgudev

packages.name: libhangul
packages.descl: This library implements Hangul keyboard input with various types of Korean keyboards. It is intended to be a base library of Korean input methods on multiple platforms.  Homepage: http://code.google.com/p/libhangul/

packages.name: libical
packages.descl: libical is an Open Source (MPL/LGPL) implementation of the IETF's iCalendar Calendaring and Scheduling protocols. (RFC 2445, 2446, and 2447). It parses iCal components and provides C/C++/Python/Java APIs for manipulating the component properties, parameters, and subcomponents.  Homepage: https://github.com/libical/libical

packages.name: libid3tag
packages.descl: libid3tag is a library for reading and (eventually) writing ID3 tags, both ID3v1 and the various versions of ID3v2.  libid3tag was written by Robert Leslie.

packages.name: libidl
packages.descl: libIDL is a library licensed under the GNU LGPL for creating trees of CORBA Interface Definition Language (IDL) files, which is a specification for defining portable interfaces.  libIDL is used by SeaMonkey and the Mozilla Suite.

packages.name: libidn
packages.descl: GNU Libidn is an implementation of the Stringprep, Punycode and IDNA specifications defined by the IETF Internationalized Domain Names (IDN) working group, used for internationalized domain names.

packages.name: libidn2
packages.descs: libidn2 (GNU Internationalized Domain Name library version 2)
packages.descl: GNU Libidn is an implementation of the Stringprep, Punycode and IDNA specifications defined by the IETF Internationalized Domain Names (IDN) working group, used for internationalized domain names.

packages.name: libieee1284
packages.descl: This library is intended to be used by applications that need to communicate with (or at least identify) devices that are attached via a parallel port. For example, SANE uses it to identify scanners.

packages.name: libimobiledevice
packages.descl: A library to communicate with services of Apple iOS devices using native protocols.  The libimobiledevice homepage: http://www.libimobiledevice.org/

packages.name: libimobiledevice-glue
packages.descl: Library with common code used by the libraries and tools from the libimobiledevice project. The main functionality provided by this library are socket helper functions and a platform independent thread/mutex implementation. It also provides a number of string, file, and plist helper functions, as well as some other commonly used code that was originally duplicated in the dedicated projects.  The libimobiledevice homepage: http://www.libimobiledevice.org/

packages.name: libindicator
packages.descl: A set of symbols and convenience functions that all indicators would like to use.  Homepage: https://launchpad.net/libindicator

packages.name: libinput
packages.descl: libinput is a library to handle input devices in Wayland compositors and to provide a generic X.Org input driver. It provides device detection, device handling, input device event processing and abstraction so minimize the amount of custom input code compositors need to provide the common set of functionality that users expect.  Homepage: http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/libinput/

packages.name: libiodbc
packages.descl: iODBC is the acronym for Independent Open DataBase Connectivity, an Open Source platform independent implementation of both the ODBC and X/Open specifications. It allows for developing solutions that are language, platform and database independent.  Homepage: http://www.iodbc.org/dataspace/iodbc/wiki/iODBC/

packages.name: libjpeg-turbo
packages.descl: libjpeg-turbo is a high-speed version of libjpeg for x86 and x86-64 processors which uses SIMD instructions to accelerate baseline JPEG compression and decompression. libjpeg-turbo is generally 2-4x as fast as the unmodified version of libjpeg, all else being equal.  Homepage: https://libjpeg-turbo.org

packages.name: libkarma
packages.descs: libkarma (library for accessing the Rio Karma music player)
packages.descl: This is a library for accessing the Rio Karma, a small media player which supports the music formats ogg vorbis, flac, mp3, wave and wma.  libkarma was mostly written by Frank Zschockelt.  Homepage: http://linux-karma.sourceforge.net

packages.name: libkcddb
packages.descl: A KDE CDDB retrieval library.

packages.name: libkcompactdisc
packages.descl: A KDE library for playing and ripping CDs.

packages.name: libkdcraw
packages.descl: Libkdcraw is a C++ interface around the dcraw binary program, used to decode RAW picture files.

packages.name: libkdegames
packages.descl: Libkdegames contains common code and data for many KDE games.

packages.name: libkdepim
packages.descl: The package contains libraries for KDE PIM applications.

packages.name: libkeduvocdocument
packages.descl: A library (formerly part of kdeedu) for reading from/writing to the KVTML format (and others too).

packages.name: libkexiv2
packages.descl: Libkexiv2 is a KDE wrapper around the Exiv2 library to manipulate image metadata.

packages.name: libkgapi
packages.descl: A KDE-based library for accessing various Google services via their public API.

packages.name: libkipi
packages.descl: This package provides a generic KDE Image Plug-in Interface used by some KDE image applications. Plug-ins for this interface are in the kipi-plugins package.  Homepage: https://github.com/KDE/libkipi

packages.name: libkkc
packages.descs: libkkc (Japanese Kana Kanji input method library)
packages.descl: libkkc provides a converter from Kana-string to Kana-Kanji-mixed -string. It was named after kkc.el in GNU Emacs, a simple Kana Kanji converter, while libkkc tries to convert sentences in a bit more complex way using N-gram language models.  Homepage: https://github.com/ueno/libkkc

packages.name: libkkc-data
packages.descl: The libkkc-data package contains the language model data that libkkc uses at run time.  Homepage: https://github.com/ueno/libkkc

packages.name: libkleo
packages.descl: This is libkleo, a library used by KDE PIM applications to handle cryptographic key and certificate management.

packages.name: libkmahjongg
packages.descl: libkmahjongg is a library used by several KDE games for loading and rendering of Mahjongg tilesets.

packages.name: libkomparediff2
packages.descl: libkomparediff2 is a shared library to compare files and strings using kdelibs and GNU diff, used in Kompare and KDevelop.

packages.name: libksane
packages.descl: Libksane is a library to add scan support to KDE applications.

packages.name: libksba
packages.descs: libksba (X.509 & CMS library for S/MIME and TLS)
packages.descl: KSBA (pronounced Kasbah) is a library to make X.509 certificates as well as the CMS easily accessible by other applications. Both specifications are building blocks of S/MIME and TLS.

packages.name: libkscreen
packages.descl: LibKScreen is a library that provides access to current configuration of connected displays and ways to change the configuration.

packages.name: libksieve
packages.descl: libksieve is a KDE PIM library for managing sieve mailfilters.

packages.name: libksysguard
packages.descl: Library to retrieve information on the current status of your computer hardware.

packages.name: libktorrent
packages.descl: Libktorrent is the BitTorrent protocol library for ktorrent, which contains all the torrent downloading code. Although it is closely related to ktorrent, the goal is to make libktorrent an independent library which can be used by other applications.  Homepage: https://kde.org/applications/en/internet/org.kde.ktorrent

packages.name: libmad
packages.descl: MAD (libmad) is a high-quality MPEG audio decoder. It currently supports MPEG-1 and the MPEG-2 extension to Lower Sampling Frequencies, as well as the so-called MPEG 2.5 format. All three audio layers (Layer I, Layer II, and Layer III a.k.a. MP3) are fully implemented. Because MAD provides full 24-bit PCM output, applications using MAD are able to produce high quality audio. MAD is distributed under the terms of the GPL.  MAD (libmad) was written by Robert Leslie.

packages.name: libmbim
packages.descl: The Mobile Broadband Interface Model (MBIM) is a new standard to communicate with mobile broadband modem devices developed by the USB Implementors Forum.  Homepage: http://www.freedesktop.org/software/libmbim/

packages.name: libmcrypt
packages.descl: Libmcrypt is a data encryption library. The library is thread safe and provides encryption and decryption functions. This version of the library supports many encryption algorithms and encryption modes. Some algorithms which are supported: SERPENT, RIJNDAEL, 3DES, GOST, SAFER+, CAST-256, RC2, XTEA, 3WAY, TWOFISH, BLOWFISH, ARCFOUR, WAKE, and more.  Homepage: http://mcrypt.sourceforge.net

packages.name: libmilter
packages.descl: The sendmail Mail Filter API (Milter) is designed to allow third party programs access to mail messages as they are being processed in order to filter meta-information and content.

packages.name: libmng
packages.descl: This is libmng, the MNG reference library. MNG (pronounced 'ming'), is short for Multiple-image Network Graphics. Designed with the same modular philosophy as PNG and by many of the same people, MNG is intended to provide a home for all of the multi-image (animation) capabilities that have no place in PNG.  libmng was written by Gerard Juyn.

packages.name: libmnl
packages.descs: libmnl (user-space library oriented to Netlink developers)
packages.descl: libmnl is a minimalistic user-space library oriented to Netlink developers. There are a lot of common tasks in parsing, validating, constructing of both the Netlink header and TLVs that are repetitive and easy to get wrong. This library aims to provide simple helpers that allows you to re-use code and to avoid re-inventing the wheel.  Homepage: http://www.netfilter.org/projects/libmnl/

packages.name: libmpc
packages.descl: mpc is a complex floating-point library with exact rounding. It is based on the GNU MPFR floating-point library (http://www.mpfr.org/), which is itself based on the GNU MP library (http://gmplib.org/).  Homepage: http://www.multiprecision.org

packages.name: libmtp
packages.descs: libmtp (A library for MTP media devices)
packages.descl: libmtp is a library that attempts to support Microsoft's Media Transfer Protocol (MTP). It was initially based on the great libptp2 library by Mariusz Woloszyn now maintained by Marcus Meissners, and Hubert Figuere's libgphoto2 work based on libptp2 (or is libptp2 based on libgphoto?). It is like a master DJ has remixed all of these tracks and then added a new API adapted for portable media players. :-)  Homepage: http://libmtp.sourceforge.net

packages.name: libmypaint
packages.descl: libmypaint (also known as 'brushlib') is a library for making brushstrokes which is used by MyPaint, GIMP, and other projects.  Homepage: http://mypaint.org

packages.name: libndp
packages.descl: libndp contains a library which provides a wrapper for IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol. It also provides a tool named ndptool for sending and receiving NDP messages.  Homepage: http://libndp.org/

packages.name: libnetfilter_acct
packages.descl: libnetfilter_acct is the userspace library providing interface to extended accounting infrastructure.  libnetfilter_acct is used by nfacct.

packages.name: libnetfilter_conntrack
packages.descl: libnetfilter_conntrack is a userspace library providing a programming interface (API) to the in-kernel connection tracking state table. This library is currently used by conntrack-tools and many other applications.  Homepage: https://www.netfilter.org/projects/libnetfilter_conntrack

packages.name: libnetfilter_cthelper
packages.descl: Connection tracking helpers allows you to filter multi-flow protocols that usually separate control and data traffic into different flows. This is the case of application protocols like FTP, SIP and H.323 that are already supported by Netfilter. These helpers are implemented in kernel-space.

packages.name: libnetfilter_cttimeout
packages.descl: libnetfilter_cttimeout is the userspace library that provides the programming interface to the fine-grain connection tracking timeout infrastructure. With this library, you can create, update and delete timeout policies that can be attached to traffic flows.

packages.name: libnetfilter_log
packages.descl: libnetfilter_log is a userspace library providing interface to packets that have been logged by the kernel packet filter. It is part of a system that deprecates the old syslog/dmesg based packet logging. This library has been previously known as libnfnetlink_log.  Homepage: http://www.netfilter.org/projects/libnetfilter_log/

packages.name: libnetfilter_queue
packages.descs: libnetfilter_queue (userspace API for netfilter packet queueing)
packages.descl: libnetfilter_queue is a userspace library providing an API to packets that have been queued by the kernel packet filter. It is part of a system that deprecates the old ip_queue / libipq mechanism.  libnetfilter_queue has been previously known as libnfnetlink_queue.  Homepage: https://netfilter.org/projects/libnetfilter_queue

packages.name: libnfnetlink
packages.descl: libnfnetlink is the low-level library for netfilter related kernel/userspace communication. It provides a generic messaging infrastructure for in-kernel netfilter subsystems (such as nfnetlink_log, nfnetlink_queue, nfnetlink_conntrack) and their respective users and/or management tools in userspace.

packages.name: libnftnl
packages.descs: libnftnl (user-space interface to the kernel nf_tables subsystem)
packages.descl: libnftnl is a userspace library providing a low-level netlink programming interface (API) to the in-kernel nf_tables subsystem. This library is currently used by nftables.  Homepage: http://www.netfilter.org/projects/libnftnl/

packages.name: libnice
packages.descl: libnice is an implementation of the IETF draft Interactive Connectivity Establishment standard (ICE). ICE is useful for applications that want to establish peer-to-peer UDP data streams. It automates the process of traversing NATs and provides security against some attacks. Existing standards that use ICE include the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) and Jingle, XMPP extension for audio/video calls.  Homepage: https://libnice.freedesktop.org

packages.name: libnih
packages.descl: libnih is a lightweight 'standard library' of C functions to ease the development of other libraries and applications.  libnih was written by Scott James Remnant <scott@netsplit.com>.  Homepage: https://github.com/keybuk/libnih

packages.name: libnjb
packages.descs: libnjb (A library for Creative Nomad related media devices)
packages.descl: libnjb is a C library and API for communicating with the Creative Nomad JukeBox and Dell DJ digital audio players under BSD, Linux, Mac OS X, and Windows. The protocol these devices use is presumably called PDE (Portable Digital Entertainment protocol) at Creative. Newer devices using the Microsoft MTP (Media Transfer Protocol) are NOT supported.  Home page: http://libnjb.sourceforge.net

packages.name: libnl
packages.descl: libnl is a library for applications dealing with netlink sockets. The library provides an interface for raw netlink messaging and various netlink family specific interfaces.  Homepage: http://people.suug.ch/~tgr/libnl/

packages.name: libnl3
packages.descl: The libnl suite is a collection of libraries providing APIs to netlink protocol based Linux kernel interfaces. Netlink is a IPC mechanism primarily between the kernel and user space processes. It was designed to be a more flexible successor to ioctl to provide mainly networking related kernel configuration and monitoring interfaces.  Homepage: https://github.com/thom311/libnl

packages.name: libnma
packages.descl: The libnma library provides an API used to create dialogs for NetworkManager clients such as network-manager-applet.  Homepage: https://wiki.gnome.org/Projects/NetworkManager/

packages.name: libnotify
packages.descl: A general library for event notification  Homepage: https://developer.gnome.org/libnotify

packages.name: libnsl
packages.descl: This package contains the libnsl library. This library contains the public client interface for NIS(YP) and NIS+. This code was formerly part of glibc, but is now standalone to be able to link against TI-RPC for IPv6 support.  Homepage: https://github.com/thkukuk/libnsl

packages.name: libnss_nis
packages.descl: This package contains the NSS NIS plugin for glibc. This code was formerly part of glibc, but is now standalone to be able to link against TI-RPC for IPv6 support.  Homepage: https://github.com/thkukuk/libnss_nis

packages.name: libodfgen
packages.descs: libodfgen (Library for generating documents in Open Document Format)
packages.descl: ilibodfgen is an ODF export library for projects using librevenge.  Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/p/libwpd/wiki/libodfgen/

packages.name: libogg
packages.descl: Libogg is a library for manipulating ogg bitstreams. It handles both making ogg bitstreams and getting packets from ogg bitstreams.  libogg is needed to use the Ogg Vorbis audio format.

packages.name: liboggz
packages.descl: Oggz comprises liboggz and the tool oggz, which provides commands to inspect, edit and validate Ogg files. The oggz-chop tool can also be used to serve time ranges of Ogg media over HTTP by any web server that supports CGI. liboggz is a C library for reading and writing Ogg files and streams. It offers various improvements over the reference libogg, including support for seeking, validation and timestamp interpretation.

packages.name: liboil
packages.descl: Liboil is a library of simple functions that are optimized for various CPUs. These functions are generally loops implementing simple algorithms, such as converting an array of N integers to floating-point numbers or multiplying and summing an array of N numbers. Such functions are candidates for significant optimization using various techniques, especially by using extended instructions provided by modern CPUs (Altivec, MMX, SSE, etc.).

packages.name: libopusenc
packages.descl: The libopusenc libraries provide a high-level API for encoding .opus files. libopusenc depends only on libopus.  Homepage: https://libopusenc-codec.org/

packages.name: libpcap
packages.descl: libpcap is a library for user-level packet capture. libpcap provides a portable framework for low-level network monitoring. Applications include network statistics collection, security monitoring, network debugging, etc. The tcpdump utility uses libpcap.  Homepage: https://www.tcpdump.org

packages.name: libpciaccess
packages.descl: libpciaccess is part of X11.  For more information about the X.Org Foundation (the providers of the X.Org implementation of the X Window System), see their website:  http://www.x.org

packages.name: libpinyin
packages.descl: The libpinyin project aims to provide the algorithms core for intelligent sentence-based Chinese pinyin input methods.  Homepage: https://github.com/libpinyin/libpinyin

packages.name: libplist
packages.descs: libplist (A library for Apple Binary and XML Property Lists)
packages.descl: libplist is a library that attempts to support Apple Binary and XML Property Lists. It is used by libgpod.  The libplist homepage: http://www.libimobiledevice.org/

packages.name: libpng
packages.descl: PNG (Portable Network Graphics) is an extensible file format for the lossless, portable, well-compressed storage of raster images. PNG provides a patent-free replacement for GIF and can also replace many common uses of TIFF. Indexed-color, grayscale, and truecolor images are supported, plus an optional alpha channel. Sample depths range from 1 to 16 bits.

packages.name: libproxy
packages.descl: libproxy exists to answer the question: Given a network resource, how do I reach it? It handles all the details, enabling you to get back to programming. Just ask libproxy what proxy to use: you get simple code and your users get correct, consistent behavior and broad infrastructure compatibility.  Homepage: https://github.com/libproxy/libproxy

packages.name: libpsl
packages.descs: libpsl (C library to handle the Public Suffix List)
packages.descl: A Public Suffix List is a collection of Top Level Domains (TLDs) suffixes. TLDs include Global Top Level Domains (gTLDs) like .com and .net; Country Top Level Domains (ccTLDs) like .de and .cn; and Brand Top Level Domains like .apple and .google. Brand TLDs allows users to register their own top level domain that exist at the same level as ICANN's gTLDs. Brand TLDs are sometimes referred to as Vanity Domains.  Homepage: https://github.com/rockdaboot/libpsl

packages.name: libpthread-stubs
packages.descl: This library provides weak aliases for pthread functions not provided in libc or otherwise available by default. Libraries like libxcb rely on pthread stubs to use pthreads optionally, becoming thread-safe when linked to libpthread, while avoiding any performance hit when running single-threaded.

packages.name: libpwquality
packages.descl: The libpwquality package provides common functions for password quality checking and also scoring them based on their apparent randomness. The library also provides a function for generating random passwords with good pronounceability.  Homepage: https://github.com/libpwquality/libpwquality

packages.name: libqalculate
packages.descl: Qalculate! is a multi-purpose desktop calculator. It is small and simple to use but with much power and versatility underneath. Features include customizable functions, units, arbitrary precision, and plotting. This package includes the library and a command-line interface.  Homepage: http://qalculate.github.io/

packages.name: libqmi
packages.descl: libqmi is a glib-based library for talking to WWAN modems and devices which speak the Qualcomm MSM Interface (QMI) protocol.  Homepage: http://www.freedesktop.org/software/libqmi/

packages.name: libraw1394
packages.descl: libraw1394 provides direct access to the IEEE 1394 bus through the Linux 1394 subsystem's raw1394 user space interface.  Homepage: http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/libs/ieee1394/

packages.name: librevenge
packages.descs: librevenge (Library for REVerse ENGineered formats filters)
packages.descl: librevenge is a base library for writing document import filters. It has interfaces for text documents, vector graphics, spreadsheets, and presentations.  Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/p/libwpd/wiki/librevenge/

packages.name: librsvg
packages.descl: Library for handling SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics).

packages.name: libsamplerate
packages.descs: libsamplerate (a Sample Rate Converter for audio)
packages.descl: Secret Rabbit Code (aka libsamplerate) is a Sample Rate Converter for audio. One example of where such a thing would be useful is converting audio from the CD sample rate of 44.1kHz to the 48kHz sample rate used by DAT players. SRC is capable of arbitrary and time varying conversions. SRC provides a small set of converters to allow quality to be traded off against computation cost.  Homepage: http://www.mega-nerd.com/SRC/

packages.name: libsass
packages.descl: This is a library implementing Sass (a CSS pre-processor) in C/C++. It is used by SassC, which is the official lightweight CLI tool built by the same people as LibSass.  Homepage: https://libsass.org

packages.name: libseccomp
packages.descl: The libseccomp library provides an easy to use, platform independent, interface to the Linux Kernel's syscall filtering mechanism. The libseccomp API is designed to abstract away the underlying BPF based syscall filter language and present a more conventional function-call based filtering interface that should be familiar to, and easily adopted by, application developers.  Homepage: https://github.com/seccomp/libseccomp

packages.name: libsecret
packages.descs: libsecret (library to access the Secret Service API)
packages.descl: libsecret is a GObject based library for accessing the Secret Service API.

packages.name: libsigc++
packages.descs: libsigc++ (typesafe callback system for standard C++)
packages.descl: libsigc++ implements a typesafe callback system for standard C++. It allows you to define signals and to connect those signals to any callback function, either global or a member function, regardless of whether it is static or virtual. It also contains adaptor classes for connection of dissimilar callbacks.  Homepage: https://github.com/libsigcplusplus/libsigcplusplus

packages.name: libsigc++3
packages.descs: libsigc++3 (callback system for standard C++ v3)
packages.descl: libsigc++3 implements a typesafe callback system for standard C++. It allows you to define signals and to connect those signals to any callback function, either global or a member function, regardless of whether it is static or virtual. It also contains adaptor classes for connection of dissimilar callbacks.  Homepage: https://github.com/libsigcplusplus/libsigcplusplus

packages.name: libsigsegv
packages.descs: libsigsegv (user mode page fault handling library)
packages.descl: This is a library for handling page faults in user mode. A page fault occurs when a program tries to access to a region of memory that is currently not available. Catching and handling a page fault is a useful technique for implementing things such as pageable virtual memory, memory-mapped access to persistent databases, generational garbage collectors, stack overflow handlers, distributed shared memory, and more.

packages.name: libsndfile
packages.descs: libsndfile (C library for reading and writing wav files)
packages.descl: Libsndfile is a C library for reading and writing files containing sampled sound (such as MS Windows WAV and Apple/SGI AIFF format).  Homepage: http://www.mega-nerd.com/libsndfile/

packages.name: libsodium
packages.descl: Sodium is a library for encryption, decryption, signatures, password hashing and more. It is a portable, cross-compilable, installable, packageable fork of NaCl, with a compatible API, and an extended API to improve usability even further.  Its goal is to provide all of the core operations needed to build higher-level cryptographic tools.  Homepage: https://libsodium.org

packages.name: libsoup
packages.descl: Soup is an HTTP client/server library implementation in C. It uses GObjects and the glib main loop to integrate well with GTK+ applications, and has a synchronous API suitable for use in threaded applications.

packages.name: libspectre
packages.descl: libspectre is a small wrapper library for ghostscript, which is used for rendering Postscript documents. The goal of libspectre is to provide a convenient, easy to use API for writing programs which handle and render Postscript documents.  Homepage: http://libspectre.freedesktop.org

packages.name: libssh
packages.descl: libssh is a mulitplatform C library implementing the SSHv2 and SSHv1 protocol on client and server side. With libssh, you can remotely execute programs, transfer files, and use a secure and transparent tunnel for your remote applications.  Homepage: http://www.libssh.org/

packages.name: libssh2
packages.descl: libssh2 is a library implementing the SSH2 protocol, available under the revised BSD license.  Homepage: https://www.libssh2.org/

packages.name: libtasn1
packages.descl: Libtasn1 is the GNU ASN.1 library. Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1) is a standard and flexible notation that describes rules and structures for representing, encoding, transmitting, and decoding data in telecommunications and computer networking.  Libtasn1 was written by Fabio Fiorina.

packages.name: libtheora
packages.descl: Theora is Xiph.Org's first publicly released video codec, intended for use within the Foundation's Ogg multimedia streaming system.  The Theora bitstream format was frozen after the alpha3 release. This means that files produced by the alpha3 encoder will always be playable according to the Theora I specification. Traditionally alpha means a proof of concept, not a production-ready release. However the code is very robust, ready for and indeed in general use.

packages.name: libtiff
packages.descs: libtiff (a library for reading and writing TIFF files)
packages.descl: This package provides support for the Tag Image File Format (TIFF), a widely used format for storing image data. Included is the libtiff library (for reading and writing TIFF files), and a collection of tools for working with TIFF images.  Homepage: http://www.simplesystems.org/libtiff

packages.name: libtirpc
packages.descl: Libtirpc is a port of Sun's Transport-Independent RPC library to Linux. It is being developed by Bull GNU/Linux NFSv4 project.  Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/libtirpc/

packages.name: libtool
packages.descl: This is GNU Libtool, a generic library support script. Libtool hides the complexity of using shared libraries behind a consistent, portable interface. To use libtool, add the new generic library building commands to your Makefile, Makefile.in, or Makefile.am. See the documentation for details.
